Cornstarch: Cornstarch is a biodegradable and renewable material that can be used as a substitute for plastic. It can be used to create biodegradable packaging materials, disposable cutlery, and even as a food additive.

Seaweed: Seaweed is a renewable and biodegradable material that can be used as a substitute for plastic. It can be used to create biodegradable packaging materials, disposable cutlery, and even as a food additive.

Cotton: Cotton is a biodegradable and renewable material that can be used as a substitute for plastic. It can be used to create biodegradable packaging materials, disposable cutlery, and even as a food additive.

Soy-based biodegradable plastics: Soy-based biodegradable plastics are a sustainable alternative to traditional plastics. They are made from renewable resources, are biodegradable, and have similar properties to traditional plastics. They can be used in the creation of disposable packaging materials, cutlery, and other everyday items.

Chitosan: Chitosan is a biodegradable and renewable material that can be used as a substitute for plastic. It is derived from the shells of crustaceans and is biodegradable, renewable, and has similar properties to traditional plastics. It can be used in the creation of disposable packaging materials, cutlery, and other everyday items.
